content: squares there will be more ends to weave in but the blanket will be the desired size important note for adding squares unless you intentionally change the design the diagonal seam will always start in the bottom right corner and finish in the top left corner before you begin knitting or casting on correctly orient the blanket with square a in the bottom right corner reading the knitting once you have worked a few squares you will become very familiar with the pattern and know exactly when it s time to work the purl row at the completion of a rs if two ridges are visible purl the ws row if you can only see one ridge knit the ws row blanket made with more than one colour 1 work square a cut the yarn end to 8 /2 cm and fasten_off or knit in the old yarn as you pick up sts for square b follow instructions below for knitting in yarn ends 2 square b add the new yarn and pick up and knit 17 sts along the left edge of square a begin the pick-up by knitting into the fastened off stitch 3 at this you point you can continue with row 1 or work square c and then square d knitting in the ends when working with different colours before cutting the old yarn knit it in as you pick up and knit with new colour this is the same technique used for trapping floats in fair isle knitting carry the old carry to the corner and cut the yarn next work the set-up row knit in the tail of the new colour on row 1 this way each yarn end is knit into its respective colour this makes for a neater back with less bulk at the seams and less weaving in later trimming the ends rather than clip the ends flush after they have been knit in i prefer to leave a slightly longer tail and hide the end under the seam to prevent the tail from popping out use a small crochet hook or tapestry needle to bring the tail under the ridge created by the slipped stitch edge 5 magic tiles blanket © brenda brayfield 2006 updated 2020 for personal use only i-cord border to work the i-cord border you will need 1 crochet hook similar size to working needle 2 waste yarn in similar or lighter weight than working yarn for provisional cast on 3 yarn for i-cord border 4 two 4mm double pointed needles photo tutorial for provisional cast on https //blog tincanknits com/2015/07/16/provisional-cast-on-needle-and-hook-method provisional cast on with waste yarn provisional cast on 5 sts with working yarn knit one row do not turn to wrong side working yarn is at the left edge picking up and knitting stitches for i-cord edge 1 start in a square second from the bottom on an edge with slipped sts 2 hold the dpn double pointed needle in your right hand working yarn
